turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1973.
turn.1: What was the most important event during the Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1973?
turn.2: With federal highway aid to the state scheduled to run out on June 30, 1973, work on a new highway bill began almost immediately in the new Congress.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In the Senate, mass transit advocates won a major victory.
turn.6: On March 14, the Senate voted to give states the authority to use up to $850 million of Highway Trust Fund money in both 1973 and 1974 for the expansion or construction of mass transit.
turn.9: What else happened during this time?
turn.10: The Senate bill also proposed spending $18 billion on highway and mass transit over three years, and included no money for highway safety or design improvement programs.
turn.12: There was weaker support for mass transit spending in the House, however.
